business.headline: India built Aadhaar, UPI. Is it time for Indian Cibil too?A three-digit number may look small on paper. But for millions of Indians, it quietly decides how far they can go. India built digital infrastructure for identity (AADHAAR) and payment (UPI). The next question is whether credit deserves the same clarity and control.

Warner Bros Discovery signs $110 billion deal with Paramount SkydanceWarner Bros Discovery agreed to a $110 billion acquisition by Paramount Skydance after Netflix declined to match the offer, creating a media powerhouse set to reshape Hollywood and streaming competition.

From FDs to mutual funds: How Indians are changing their investment behaviourFor years, FDs and real estate were the first choice for Indian savers seeking safety and certainty. Now, mutual funds are steadily gaining popularity, especially among first-time investors looking for higher returns. Is this the beginning of a long-term shift in how Indians invest?

India's Q3 GDP grows 7.8% as government rolls out new base year seriesThe Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation introduced a new series of GDP estimates with 2022-23 as the base year, replacing the earlier 2011-12 base.

Sensex, Nifty fall over 1% as global worries mount; auto, financial shares tankThe S&P BSE Sensex tanked 961.42 points to close at 81,287.19, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 317.90 points to end at 25,178.65.

Pakistan to run short of flour? Wheat output likely to fall amid Afghanistan warAccording to a report by the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA), Pakistan's wheat production is expected to decline by 2 to 2.2 million tonnes compared to last year.

Including property in your will? Here's how to avoid family and legal conflictsA house is often the most valuable thing people leave behind. Yet, without proper details in a Will, like ownership clarity, liabilities, and documentation, it can become the very reason families face delays and disagreements instead of closure. Is your Will detailed enough to prevent that?

Why India's growing wealth is driving investment into luxury real estateAs capital increases, investors become more careful. The focus shifts from chasing returns to protecting value. This is why luxury real estate is gaining importance in serious portfolios.

Silver jumps over Rs 8,000: Time to invest, hold or sell?Silver shot up by over Rs 8,000, marking a fresh high in recent trading. With momentum high but volatility looming, the big question is: is it time to invest or sell?

What are Life Cycle Funds and how can they make your retirement planning easier?Life cycle funds are designed to adjust their asset allocation automatically as an investor moves closer to a specific goal, usually retirement.

Sensex closes 961 points lower: Why stock market fell todayThe S&P BSE Sensex tanked 961.42 points to close at 81,287.19, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 317.90 points to end at 25,178.65.  Both indices lost over 1%.

Block's 4,000 job cuts: Why layoffs are no longer a sign of crisisBlock said it would cut more than 4,000 jobs, nearly half its workforce, reducing staff from over 10,000 to just under 6,000. This was not a company in distress. It was a company growing.
Sensex opens 277 points lower, Nifty below 25,400; Infosys up 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 389.29 points to 81,866.32, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 154.55 points to 25,342.00 as of 9:50 am.

Rs 583 crore returned, full-page ads out – is IDFC First Bank's trust push enough?IDFC First Bank's response offers a rare test of corporate accountability. But will a quick refund and bold messaging be enough to turn a damaging crisis into a chance to rebuild trust? We spoke to experts to understand what real recovery will demand.

Netflix calls Warner deal not attractive, clears path for ParamountNetflix declined to raise its bid for Warner Bros. Discovery, clearing the way for Paramount's $31-per-share takeover offer that could reshape Hollywood and trigger major antitrust scrutiny.

Earning Rs 30 lakh a year but little wealth? Why many DINK couples fall behindWith two salaries and no childcare costs, DINK couples are often seen as having a clear financial advantage. Yet many high-earning couples find their wealth growing slower than expected. Is lifestyle inflation quietly eroding their investment potential?

India, Israel sign MoU to link UPI systems, boost digital payment tiesThe integration is expected to help Indian and Israeli businesses and individuals carry out financial transactions more easily. It could also reduce transaction costs and processing time, making payments faster and more convenient.

World Economic Forum chief Borge Brende quits amid probe into Epstein tiesBorge Brende, President and CEO of the World Economic Forum, has stepped down amid scrutiny over his past interactions with Jeffrey Epstein.
Sensex and Nifty erase early gains to end flat over global uncertaintyThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 27.46 points to close at 82,248.61, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 14.05 points to end at 25,496.55.

MeitY Secretary S Krishnan says social media must work within constitutional limitsS Krishnan defended the government's approach to regulating digital platforms. He said the Ministry's actions are firmly rooted in the Constitution and follow due legal process.

entertainment.headline: Yash's Toxic builds buzz as makers announce trailer release date. See here The much-awaited trailer of Yash's upcoming film Toxic will be unveiled on March 8 in Bengaluru. Directed by National Award winner Geetu Mohandas, the stylish action drama will release on March 19.

Rajpal Yadav launches YouTube channel after release on bail, seeks fans' support Rajpal Yadav has launched his official YouTube channel shortly after being released on interim bail in a cheque-bounce case.

Hello Bachchon trailer: Viineet Kumar toplines series on Alakh Pandey's journey The trailer for Hello Bachchon was unveiled on February 28, introducing a series inspired by educator Alakh Pandey. The Netflix show follows students from different backgrounds and premieres on March 6.

Ranabaali: Rashmika Mandanna, Vijay Deverakonda shine in song Endhayya Saami The song Endhayya Saami from Ranabaali was unveiled as a special surprise by newly-wed couple Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda. The film, directed by Rahul Sankrityan, is set to release worldwide on September 11, 2026.

The Kerala Story 2 sees low opening occupancy Kerala, some screenings cancelled The Kerala Story 2: Goes Beyond opened to low occupancy in parts of Kerala, with some screenings reportedly cancelled due to lack of audience. Advance booking on the second day is limited.

Alia Bhatt addresses BAFTA red carpet backlash: Is it because of my expression? Alia Bhatt has addressed the online criticism over her BAFTA red carpet interview, and has clarified her reaction to a particular question that might have started it all.

Benny Blanco reacts to viral dirty feet backlash, shows off clean bare foot Benny Blanco addressed the viral "dirty feet" controversy from his podcast during a recent interview. He clarified that the floors were to blame, not his hygiene.

India's finest stories are waiting. Why won't Bollywood book new scripts? Why is Bollywood not adapting more from India's rich literary canon? This week's Cinematic Saturday explores the gap that continues to exist between books and cinema in Hindi, and how the film industry may be ignoring some of India's greatest tales.

Sankalp teaser: Nana Patekar makes OTT debut in Prakash Jha's socio-political saga Filmmaker Prakash Jha's upcoming series Sankalp marks Nana Patekar's OTT debut and explores themes of power, ideology and control. The show will stream for free on Amazon MX Player, with the release date yet to be announced.

Ektaa Kapoor issues alert on fake casting scam in Balaji's name. Read statement Ektaa Kapoor's production house, Balaji Telefilms, issued a statement that all casting for the banner is managed through its official channels. They urged the public not to pay for auditions or share personal data with unverified sources.

Black, bold, Bhatt: Alia rocks Gucci's Primavera show. See pics Alia Bhatt appeared at Milan Fashion Week dressed in an all-black ensemble for Gucci's debut runway under new creative director Demna Gvasalia. Several pictures of the actor from the global event have gone viral.

Ranabaali: Rashmika-Vijay's big surprise after wedding coming up on February 28 Even as their wedding continues to make news, Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda get set to unveil a major surprise about their upcoming film Ranabaali on February 28.

The Kerala Story 2 producer Vipul Shah reacts as High Court clears film's release Vipul Shah welcomed the Kerala High Court's decision to lift the interim stay on The Kerala Story 2: Goes Beyond. The order was passed by a division bench comprising Justices SA Dharmadhikari and PV Balakrishnan.

Who is Sangeetha Sornalingam? Actor Vijay's wife files for divorce after 27 years Sangeetha Sornalingam, wife of Tamil actor and TVK chief Vijay, has filed for divorce in the Chengalpattu family court, alleging her husband's involvement in an extramarital affair. The couple, married since 1999, has two children together.

Prakash Raj exits Prabhas and Sandeep Reddy Vanga's Spirit: Report Actor Prakash Raj has reportedly exited Sandeep Reddy Vanga's upcoming film Spirit, starring Prabhas. The update came as the team welcomed Vivek Oberoi as part of the cast.

Vishnu Vinyasam review: Sree Vishnu's film is a painful collection of unfunny reelsRelease Date:Fri Feb 27, 2026 Vishnu Vinyasam movie review: Director Yadunaath Maruthi Rao's Vishnu Vinyasam, starring Sree Vishnu and Nayan Sarika, is a painfully unfunny film. The film draws inspiration from many social media trends, but has zero impact.

Sriram Raghavan addresses Ikkis backlash; says those objecting haven't seen the film Sriram Raghavan admitted that he was baffled at the first reactions to his war-drama Ikkis. He said that those who have objected haven't even seen the film.

Dipika Kakar in pain after cyst surgery, shares health update in new vlog Actor Dipika Kakar has undergone a second liver surgery after being diagnosed with a malignant tumour last year. Her husband, Shoaib Ibrahim, confirmed the success of the procedure and provided an update on her current health.

Zubeen Garg honoured posthumously with 3 Filmfare Awards for contribution to music Iconic singer Zubeen Garg was honoured at the Filmfare Awards Assamese 2026 in Guwahati with a heartfelt tribute. The late artist received three posthumous awards, recognising his enduring contribution to music and Assamese cinema.

general news.headline: Live: Iran hits US bases in Bahrain, Kuwait, UAE in retaliatory strikesUS-Israel's Iran Strikes Live Updates: The US and Israel launched strikes on Iran on Saturday, igniting military tensions in the Middle East, which has been on the brink of a conflict for several weeks. Israel said the US-led operation, called Epic Fury, had launched pre-emptive strikes. US President Donald Trump confirmed a "major combat operation" as explosions were heard in several parts of Iran. Tehran, which promised a "crushing" response to the US-led strikes, attacked US bases across the Middle East, including those in the UAE, Bahrain, Qatar and Jordan. Countries in the Middle East have shut their airspace while several countries have issued advisories to its citizens, asking them to take shelter and avoid unnecessary movement. Follow indiatoday.in for live updates.

US, Israel launch Operation Epic Fury against Iran; Tehran strikes back  Live UpdatesMassive explosions were heard in Tehran as Israel launched what it described as a preventive missile strike, amid escalating tensions between Washington and Tehran.

Stand down or face death, Trump warns Iran in televised speech amid US strikesThe US President mentioned that Iran was trying to rebuild its nuclear programme and, as a result, it suffered a joint attack by the US and Israel.

Where is Khamenei? Concerns amid attack on Supreme Leader's officeThe first wave of US-Israel strikes was directed towards damaging the political leadership of Iran, as the President's residence and Ali Khamenei's office were targeted. It has led to questions if the US is aiming at regime change in Iran as it did in Venezuela.

Video: How flights cleared Iran airspace after US-Israel strikesJoint US-Israel strikes on Iran triggered explosions in Tehran and led to the closure of Iranian airspace, as seen in a video that surfaced showing flights clearing out in the airspace after the attacks.

Jammu and Kashmir dominate Karnataka to end 67-year wait for maiden Ranji titleJammu and Kashmir finally broke their 67-year wait to lift a maiden Ranji Trophy title. A commanding first-innings lead and complete control over five days ensured Karnataka were left with no path back in the 2026 final.

US, Israel attack Iran, explosions rock Gulf, 1 dead in UAE. What we knowMissiles criss-crossed the Middle East on Saturday as the US and Israel attacked Iran and struck its political leadership. Iran and its proxies retaliated by launching a barrage of drones and missiles towards Israel and US bases across the Middle East, plunging the region into a new conflict.

Spying, powering killer robots: Behind Trump's war with AI firm AnthropicA dispute over how the US military can use AI has Anthropic facing the full wrath of US President Donald Trump. The development is crucial amid the threat of a US-Iran conflict. But why has Trump suddenly gone nuclear on Anthropic? What comes next for the AI firm?

India's finest stories are waiting. Why won't Bollywood book new scripts?Why is Bollywood not adapting more from India's rich literary canon? This week's Cinematic Saturday explores the gap that continues to exist between books and cinema in Hindi, and how the film industry may be ignoring some of India's greatest tales.

Live: How difficult was the paper? Expert analysis hereCBSE Chemistry Board Exam 2026 LIVE: The CBSE Class 12 Chemistry exam 2026 has concluded across centres in the country. Detailed paper analysis and expert review are now available, with students also sharing their reactions. Check full details and expert review here.

Iranian missile hits US Navy's Fifth Fleet naval base in Bahrain amid rising tensionThe retaliation by Iran came hours after the US Department of Defence authorised a departure notice for all the military personnel in Bahrain.

Follow news, advisories: India to its citizens in Qatar, launches 24x7 helplineIndia has issued an advisory for its citizens in Qatar after the US and Israel launched strikes on Iran, escalating tension in the Middle East.

No IIT, no IIM: Why your course may matter more in 2026Handcrafted ByOur Editors As artificial intelligence redraws career paths and disrupts traditional job roles, India's long-standing obsession with elite college tags is facing its first serious test. In an AI-driven economy, the value of what students learn is increasingly challenging the prestige of where they study.

DMK's Rajya Sabha seat tactic to push Congress in alliance talks, sets deadlineThe DMK is leveraging a Rajya Sabha seat to press the Congress to finalise seat-sharing talks ahead of the Tamil Nadu Assembly polls. The party has set a March 6 deadline, saying a delay could push the Congress's Rajya Sabha berth to next year, sources said.

Air India, IndiGo suspend all Middle East flights as US-Iran tensions escalateAir India and IndiGo have suspended all Middle East flights amid escalating US-Israel strikes on Iran and retaliatory attacks, leading to widespread airspace closures.

Missiles and drones launched from Iran toward Israel after Tehran strike, says IRGCThe escalation by Iran follows what Israel described as a pre-emptive strike on Tehran, raising the prospect of a broader confrontation between the two regional adversaries.

AI is killing the single-job era: Moonlighting goes mainstreamSide hustles, reels, freelancing and podcasts: professionals are no longer relying on just one career stream. Why must you read this article? Because parallel careers are fast becoming the new workplace reality
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Odisha woman raped by boyfriend during elopement plan, later killed by strangerThe woman was first raped by her boyfriend, who later abandoned her. She was then taken by a stranger to another location, where he raped her and pushed her from the fourth floor.

The empty leash: The K9 dog soldiers who took bullets firstFrom counter-terror operations in Jammu and Kashmir to high-risk search missions across India, the dogs of the Indian military and paramilitary have always taken the lead, and have often paid with their lives while protecting the soldiers they serve beside. This write-up is a reminder of the wars they have fought for us.

Exclusive: What went behind making Rashmika-Vijay's heavy gold wedding jewelleryHint: It took over 10 months to craft Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda's wedding jewellery, and the couple was deeply involved in the process.

300 Afghan Taliban fighters killed, Pakistan claims as global powers urge restraint Live UpdatesThe escalation follows Pakistan's launch of Operation Ghazab lil-Haq after alleged cross-border attacks, even as the Afghan Taliban signalled willingness for dialogue. Multiple countries and international organisations have meanwhile called for immediate de-escalation between the two sides.

3 Bishnoi gang shooters fire at Haryana supplements shop, attack caught on cameraThree armed men linked to the Lawrence Bishnoi gang opened fire at a supplements store in Haryana's Sonipat. Police suspect the shooting as a case of gang rivalry and identified two shooters based on the CCTV footage.

Paid to defame AI Summit? Influencers accusing Congress now deleting videosJust after it ended, at least 15 content creators on Instagram alleged that the Congress offered them money to malign the India AI Impact Summit. But what really happened?

sports.headline: Ranji Trophy final: Auqib Nabi turns title dream into history for Jammu and Kashmir Auqib Nabi started his cricketing journey with the dream of winning the Ranji Trophy one day. On Saturday, February 28, Nabi became the big game player that propelled J&K to their first-ever title with an impressive five-wicket haul.

The lights went out too soon: Can India finally get Formula 1 right? India had Formula 1 for three years, then lost it to taxes, red tape, and short-termism. More than a decade on, the fight to bring it back is finally getting serious.

Jammu and Kashmir dominate Karnataka to end 67-year wait for maiden Ranji title Jammu and Kashmir finally broke their 67-year wait to lift a maiden Ranji Trophy title. A commanding first-innings lead and complete control over five days ensured Karnataka were left with no path back in the 2026 final.

Doesn't matter if Pakistan qualify to semis, India will not: Amir's big statement Pakistan pacer Mohammad Amir has made the bold claim that India will not make it to the semi-finals of the T20 World Cup 2026. India and Pakistan retain a chance of making it to the final four.

Indian hockey in trouble: Can Craig Fulton's lost team make its way back? After a collapse in the FIH Pro League, India coach Craig Fulton's biggest test yet comes in the form of a resurrection of the team. With the World Cup and Asian Games on the horizon, the Indian coach needs to quickly get his side to forget the slump in Rourkela and Hobart and get ready for bigger challenges.

Pakistan's last roll of the dice as Sri Lanka stand between them and semis T20 World Cup: Sri Lanka stand between Pakistan and a miracle semi-final push. One commanding win keeps the dream alive, while anything less could end Pakistan's campaign despite England handing them a late lifeline.

UP Kabaddi League takes cricket route to produce next-gen India stars A cricket-style revolution is underway in Kabaddi as the UP Kabbadi League sets itself up to be the breeding ground to be the platform for the rise of new talent. With competition and fan following on the rise, the league promises to produce India's next big names in Kabaddi.

Messi tackled by pitch invaders in Inter Miami's chaotic Puerto Rico friendly A pitch invasion turned messy as Lionel Messi was knocked over during Inter Miami's Puerto Rico friendly. The Argentine star quickly got back up, shrugged it off, and still guided Miami to a 2-1 win.

Delhi HC orders fresh EFI polls, IOA to form Ad-Hoc Panel The Delhi High Court has called for a revamp of the Equestrian Federation of India, calling for fresh elections. It has also asked the Indian Olympic Association to form an ad-hoc panel to oversee the functions.

Jammu and Kashmir's wait is finally over: Parvez Rasool ahead of Ranji Trophy glory Jammu and Kashmir have moved within one day of winning their maiden Ranji Trophy title, and Parvez Rasool hailed the moment as a dream turned reality for the side. A dominant performance has put them on the brink of scripting history in Indian domestic cricket.

England not obsessed with perfection in T20 World Cup: Will Jacks after NZ heroicsT20 World Cup: England all-rounder Will Jacks emphasised that the side is more focused on winning than any fixation of being perfect in their campaign as they head into the semi-finals. While England's margin of victories have been tight, the side is more focused on the positives.

Nervous New Zealand will have eyes on PAK vs SL: Mitchell Santner on semi-final hopesT20 World Cup: New Zealand's semi-final hopes now hinge on Pakistan's final Super 8 result against Sri Lanka. After missing their own chance against England, the Kiwis can only wait nervously as qualification slipped out of their control.

2016 heartbreak in past, India look to return the favour to West IndiesT20 World Cup, IND vs WI: Back in 2016, it was the West Indies who eliminated India with a thrilling semifinal victory. This time, India have the opportunity to turn the tables when the two teams meet in the Super 8 clash on March 1 in Kolkata.

West Indies return to hallowed Eden hoping to conjure Calypso magic vs IndiaIND vs WI, T20 World Cup 2026 Super 8s: West Indies are set to play India in a virtual quarter-final in the T20 World Cup 2026. Despite being the favourites, India should not make the mistake of counting out the West Indies.

New Zealand stare helplessly at Pakistan vs Sri Lanka after losing to EnglandT20 World Cup, ENG vs NZ: New Zealand no longer have their fate in their own hands, and the Pakistan vs Sri Lanka clash on Saturday in Pallekele will determine the second semi-finalist from Group 2.

MS Dhoni issued notice by Jharkhand Housing Board over misuse of residential plotJharkhand Housing Board has issued a notice to MS Dhoni over alleged misuse of his residential plot in Ranchi. The inquiry could lead to cancellation of the plot if violations are confirmed.

Pakistan can reach T20 World Cup semis and more: Salman Mirza before Sri Lanka clashT20 World Cup, PAK vs SL: Fast bowler Salman Mirza expressed confidence that Pakistan are not only capable of reaching the semifinals but can also make a strong impact once there. Pakistan will take on Sri Lanka in their final Super 8 clash on Saturday in Pallekele.

Ravi Shastri to have stand named after him at Mumbai's Wankhede stadiumWankhede Stadium honours cricket legends as MCA names stand after Ravi Shastri and dedicates three gates to Dilip Sardesai, Diana Edulji and Eknath Solkar in tribute to Mumbai's rich heritage.

Pakistan still have an outside chance of reaching the T20 World Cup semisT20 World Cup Pakistan's semi final qualification scenario: England's four-wicket victory over New Zealand has kept Pakistan's semi-final hopes alive in the tournament. Here's the complete explanation of what Pakistan need to do to progress ahead in the event:

Pakistan stay alive for semis berth after England beat New Zealand in ColomboT20 World Cup, ENG vs NZ: England beat New Zealand by four wickets in Colombo on Saturday after chasing down 160 with three balls to spare. With England's win, Pakistan also stayed alive in the competition and will have everything to play for when they face Sri Lanka.

T20 World Cup: Rinku Singh to link-up with Indian team in Kolkata after father's last ritesT20 World Cup: Rinku Singh is set to rejoin the India camp after completing his father Khanchand Singh's last rites in Aligarh.  India are set to face the West Indies in their final Super 8s fixture in Kolkata.

Can Pakistan reach the semis? Salman Mirza stays optimistic before Sri Lanka clashT20 World Cup, PAK vs SL: Pakistan pacer Salman Mirza opened up on his team's chances of qualifying for the semi-finals. Pakistan's last Super 8 match is against Sri Lanka on February 28.

IPL 2026 likely to start on March 28, final to be played on May 31The Indian Premier League 2026 (IPL 2026) is likely to start on March 28 with the final of the competition to be played on May 31. The tournament was initially expected to get under way on March 26. However, the start date has now been pushed back by two days.

Ranji Trophy final: Auqib Nabi, Qamran Iqbal take J&K on cusp of historic triumphJammu and Kashmir finished Day 4 of the Ranji Trophy final in a strong position against Karnataka. Their dominant performance have brought them closer to their maiden title victory.

J&K on brink of maiden Ranji Trophy title as CM Omar Abdullah heads to final venueJammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah is heading to Hubli as the state stands on the brink of winning their maiden Ranji Trophy title with a commanding 477-run lead over Karnataka.

ENG vs NZ Highlights Super 8: Ahmed, Jacks guide England home, keep Pakistan aliveEngland (ENG) vs New Zealand (NZ) Highlights, T20 World Cup Super 8: England have beaten New Zealand by 4 wickets and kept Pakistan alive in the semi finals race. Will Jacks and Rehan Ahmed guided England home.

Real Madrid to face Man City as UCL's R016 serves up heavyweight clashesUEFA Champions League: Real Madrid will face Manchester City in a heavyweight clash as the Champions League Round of 16 draw delivered blockbuster matchups, with PSG taking on Chelsea in another standout fixture.

India Women make horror start to post World Cup-era, lose ODI series to AustraliaINDW vs AUSW: India defeated Australia by five wickets in the second ODI on Friday to take a 2-0 lead in the three-match series. Chasing 252, Georgia Voll's 101 helped the Aussies romp home with 83 balls to spare.

Rinku Singh stands in silent grief, shoulders father's mortal remains in AligarhIndia batter Rinku Singh performed the last rites of his father Khanchand Singh, who died after a prolonged battle with liver cancer. The cricketing fraternity also expressed condolences to Rinku and his family.

Rinku Singh's father passes away, Kohli leads tributes from Indian cricket fraternityThe Indian cricket fraternity united in support of Rinku Singh after his father's passing, with Virat Kohli, Yuvraj Singh, and several other stars offering heartfelt condolences and prayers.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
